inclusion.criterion: Male or female toddler who was vaccinated 1, 3 or 5 years ago with the last dose of MenACWY-TT in study with NCT number=00471081.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent obtained from parents/guardian of the subject.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Healthy subjects as established by medical history before entering into the study.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Having completed the active phase of the vaccination study with NCT number=00471081.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent obtained from parents/guardian of the subject.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects who can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A male or female between, and including, 5-6 years of age at the time of the vaccination.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent obtained from parents/guardian of the subject.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Healthy subjects as established by medical history and history-directed physical examination before entering into the study.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) within 30 days of each persistence timepoint.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Vaccination with meningococcal polysaccharide or conjugate vaccine of serogroup A, B, C, W-135, and/or Y outside of study with NCT number=00471081.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: History of any meningococcal disease due to serogroup A, B, C, W-135, or Y.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficiency condition based on medical history and physical examination (no laboratory testing is required).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within the three months preceding each persistence timepoint.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome, but it is unclear if this would affect their eligibility for the study. They have also received vaccinations in the past, which may be relevant to the study.
